title: From URL to Interactive
excerpt: Imagine, if you will, that you’re behind the wheel of a gorgeous 1957 Chevy Bel Air convertible, making your way across the desert on a wide open highway. The sun is setting, so you’ve got the top down, naturally.

title: Everyday Information Architecture: Auditing for Structure
excerpt: Enter the structural audit: a review of the site focused solely on its menus, links, flows, and hierarchies. I know you thought we were done with audits back in Chapter 2, but hear me out!

title: She told them she was Hugo Chavez’s ex-wife and worked in the White House
excerpt: The irresistibly charming woman in Apartment 713 can hold forth for hours with tales of her luxe life among the intercontinental elite, neighbors say.

title: The Olympics Are Over, but Tessa Virtue Is Just Getting Started
excerpt: It's been one year since she became the most famous figure skater in the world. How do you move on from being the best?

title: Long Day's Journey
excerpt: If you really want to experience a place, see it on foot. That’s how Elizabeth Gilbert spent two weeks, walking across Provence (come on, it’s only ten miles a day), eating like a local (duck liver and stinky cheeses), and drinking (and drinking) her way to the vacation of a lifetime

title: How Chicago house got its groove back
excerpt: That's a line for a DJ to live by if ever there were one. And if there were ever a DJ to proclaim it, Carlos Sosa is that DJ. Sosa is better known as DJ Sneak, though he also calls himself — not as a declaration of criminality, but as a ride-or-die pledge of roots.

title: Oyster Stakes
excerpt: The Oyster Stakes is a Listed flat horse race in Ireland open to thoroughbred fillies and mares aged three years or older. It is run at Galway over a distance of 1 mile 4 furlongs and 49 yards (2,459 metres), and it is scheduled to take place each year in September.

title: The Lost Girls of Rocky Mount
excerpt: In a small town in rural North Carolina, a serial killer has evaded justice for six years by sticking to a ruthlessly simple plan: He preys on black women who have slipped away from their lives, who live and hustle on the streets—the ones who are already almost dead

title: HOOKED FOR LIFE
excerpt: Inside the NFL's relentless, existential, Big Tobacco-style pursuit of your children.

title: One lawyer’s crusade to defend extreme pornography
excerpt: Myles Jackman is on a mission to change Britain’s obscenity laws. For him, it’s more than a job, it’s a moral calling
